Reviews.Title: Great tv, great price
Reviews.Author: Trebor Mints
Reviews.Content: I researched LCD TV models and prices for over a year, checking them out in a local store.  When I saw this Samsung, I jumped at it:* Price was right, under $700* Great picture with super low refresh rate(to minimize the blurring you see on older sets).* The one in the store ran much cooler than older models.  This was important as I wanted to put the set inside my entertainment cabinet.* Great tuner: My old analog TV could only pick up 2 channels via the antenna. (I mostly watch DVDs.) The Samsung picked up over 20 digital channels flawlessly, just using a $20 RadioShack inside antenna!  I don't need cable!* The picture is simply stunning when you are viewing a hi-definition broadcast (1080i).  I gasped when I first saw it.Only downside: You can't use a VCR with this set because it doesn't have the outdated composite video input that VCRs require, only the newer component and HDMI inputs.I've had this set for a couple of months and I love it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for best price around
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I've had this for about a month now. Everything is simple to use and looks very sharp compared to the other 32" LCDs I looked at best buy and Circuit City.Make sure you by a component cable and have HD cable to get high res imaging or everything will look blurry.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: I'm no TV expert but thought I'd add my thoughts.  I've had this for about 3 weeks now.- Excellent picture. Also handles non HD broadcasts very well.  HD is obviously superb.- Excellent for gaming.  Even fast paced games like COD4 (Xbox 360).- On board sound is very good.  I haven't yet felt the need to connect my home theater.- Amazon delivery via their couriers was prompt and professional.- Amazon price saves you a good $50 or more from other retailers.

Reviews.Title: Known sound distortion problems with this TV
Reviews.Author: A. Hutton
Reviews.Content: I bought the TV November 08.  I am having a sound distortion problem with the television on HD channels.  This is exactly the same sort of sound distortion described in another review.Samsung is still currently researching this issue and does not have a fix for it yet.  The temporary fix is to do a factory reset by holding down the exit button for greater than 10 seconds.  Every time the TV loses power (unplugged or brown out) you will have to do a factory reset of the TV to correct the sound distortion problem.I WOULD HIGHLY SUGGEST people check out this issue on the CNET forums [...] and type in "LN32A330 sound distortion" before purchasing the television.This is not an isolated problem and apparently many many Samsung LCD televisions are having this issue.I just wanted to add this review so that you can educate yourself on a possible problem when you decide which TV you are going to purchase.

Reviews.Title: nice performing and relatively inexpensive enty level HDTV
Reviews.Author: D. Kelly
Reviews.Content: Just bought this set a couple of days ago. I have had my eye on the new models that run at 120hz but just couldn't justify paying over $1600 on th 46 inch set I wanted. I bought this set as a test to see if the reviews on Samsung sets are accurate.Set up is a snap with this set. I only had to consult the manual to figure out how to turn off the welcoming chimes. Everything else is easily found on the on screen menue.DTV stations on my over the air antenna look great. Weak analog stations need some picture manipulation to make them visible but the tuner over all performs well. HDTV content over the satellite is excellent. I was suprised at how well the set performs on fast motion action. It's rated a 6ms which is just 2ms more than the much pricier 120hz models. Granted you don't get as high of a contrast ration, but for the price I can't complain the black level is good. Blue ray disks and playstation 3 games look amazing.I run the sound through my Denon home theater and it performs well. The set speakers do an adequate job although sound separation is limited even with the SRS sound engaged so I just use my Linaeum center channel.I plan on using this set as a pc monitor as well, I just haven't hooked it up yet.I still plan on buying the LNA630 wich is full 1080p and runs at 120hz, but until the price drops this set will suffice.Bottom line this is a good set for the price and it is small enough that you don't need to run 1080p. The refresh rate is only 60hz but motion blur is minimal. The only down side is the remote is not back lit and seems a little cheap. I will review this set again in six months to keep you posted on how it is holding up. If it continues to perform well I should be buying another larger set at that time.

Reviews.Title: Best for the Price
Reviews.Author: R. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: After much reviewing of Sony,Toshiba and Samsung, I decided on the Samsung LN32A330 and have had it for a couple of weeks now. It was very easy to set up and after adjusting for a couple of days, I think it is really beautiful. Great Picture. The only negative i find is that to get a full picture you sometimes have to use the zoom setting. I don't like the 16.9 setting on some stations with the smaller picture. Still for the price I paid at Amazon.com, and the great service, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV at good price.
Reviews.Author: Richie
Reviews.Content: I got this off Amazon for about $640 (after a $50 coupon). Which is a great price for a 32" LCD. It was either this or a Vizio from Wal-Mart. I decided to get this as if I purchased from Wal-Mart I would have to pay sales tax and CA recylcing fees.It came with free delivery. It says in the ad that it is white glove and they unpackage it etc, but they just dropped it at the door and left.The picture and sound is very good - just as good as my 42" Hitachi which I paid over $2000 for 3 years ago. The only negative is that it makes a loud beeping noise when you turn on and off. I am not sure if you can change that somewhere. But my TV is in the bedroom. If I am watching something late and turn it off, the noise wakes my wife up. Also I dont like the remote control. It looks cheap. But that is no big deal as I use the cable remote to control it.

Reviews.Title: My major HDTV Step-up
Reviews.Author: Thomas C. Stoddard "connoisseur"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as my first HD product. WOW!! I am impressed. Crisp, clear picture, very vivid color.But, what I would most comment on is the sound. I purposefully steered away from other models where the speakers were in the bottom, or out the side, these are mounted on either side, and project toward the front, stereo, of course, and I am enjoying a rich, full quality which was a pleasant surprise, especially when I put on the satellite music channels. It's almost as good as the tabletop stereo set for quality, and I still have not taken it up to full volume range.For the price and quality, I am very pleased.I have this mounted in the wall of our bedroom, and it is perfect size for that spot. Not too big to be overwhelming, but still very watchable and enjoyable for the hours when in there lounging and resting.

Reviews.Title: My World of Television Watching has Changed Forever
Reviews.Author: Kathy Denley "Randal (Musician) Denley"
Reviews.Content: All my life I have owned conventional television sets of various sizes, and have always enjoyed watching most any shows, but in particular music. This of course has made me want better sound quality even more than picture quality. Once I actually saw the difference in High Definition, WOW!!! When you can see which strings are more worn than others on guitars, seee the seams on bluegenes, and even see shirt buttons, and what type they are, again WOW!! The Samsung HDTV we purchased is a 32" inch, and though that sounds small, it's not. it has excellent visibility from all around the room. The only negative remark I can & will make is the sound, as it has excellent stero sound on the television speakers, they just don't carry the lows and deep richness you need for realistic movie or MUSIC quality. I am running my system through a Pioneer 60 watt system with two bottom cabinets and two mid cabinets, and I let the TV carry the highs and the Pioneer system handle all the lows and richness. Overall opinion: excellent quality unit and GREAT SERVICE FROM AMAZON!!!! Delivery was ahead of time and package was in perfect condition. The delivery person from CEVA even stayed until we unpacked the Tv to insure its quality. Delightful young man and very helpful!!  Thank you AMAZON & CEVA....Happy Trails....Randal Denley

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value!
Reviews.Author: A. Nauta Jr.
Reviews.Content: This television is my first HDTV and I love it!  The picture is amazing compared to the other brand 32" televisions i saw at Best Buy.  My XBOX 360 looks ridiculously clear and the level of detail is phenomenal.  The sound is excellent too.  It fills my entire bedroom and my sister fusses when i have the volume setting over 25%.  The only complaint I have about this television is the lack of the standard composite RCA inputs.  I cannot connect my camera and similar devices without component outputs or HDMI outputs.  I purchased this TV on Amazon.com for [..] with free shipping which i believe is an excellent bargain.  I highly recommend this Samsung television to any first time HDTV buyer.  It is an excellent bedroom tv.

Reviews.Title: Dead after 2 years!!!
Reviews.Author: T. W. Wasson
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV in May of 2008 - today I go to turn it on (after using it just last night), and it won't even turn on.  I call Samsung, they have me unplug it from the surge protector and plug it into the wall - nothing.  They ask me if it's connected to a computer - I tell them no.  They take all of my info and the serial number and politely tell me that I will be responsible for paying for the repairs on the TV as one of the internal components has failed.  I tell them that I do not think that is fair considering I spent around $800 at the time to purchase this TV and now I have to pay to fix it after only 2 years.  They say there's nothing they can do and set up a service ticket for me, and then I can decide whether or not I will pay to repair the TV once the repair service calls me to tell me how much it will cost to fix it.  I can tell you one decision I've already made, and that's to NEVER BUY ANOTHER SAMSUNG PRODUCT AGAIN.  Before my TV I had a Samsung DVD player that also died after 2 years.  So it looks like the average life expectancy on a Samsung product is 2 years.  For the money, I'd say that's ridiculous.  So there you go Samsung, you've lost both a customer and a promoter.  I will never cease to tell everyone I know to never buy your products.

Reviews.Title: arrived broken
Reviews.Author: Stephen Levinson
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this TV. It looked great in the store. The price was right. But it came out of the box broken. It turns on for about half a second, then goes black. Samsung tech support tried transferring me to "level two service" twice, each time I was disconnected before the third tech person said that level two service was closed. I had to call the next day to schedule an appointment for them to come to my place to repair it, and now I'm going to have to use a vacation day waiting from them to come out, because they don't do repairs evenings or weekends. So far, a pretty miserable experience.UPDATE: Samsung repair came to the house, but they didn't bring the right part. Apparently, this TV's innards are plastic, not metal like the last model, and the official Samsung repair people didn't even have this plastic part yet. A day taken off of work for nothing.UPDATE2: Got a replacement TV and it's great. Great picture for the price. BTW, the reviewer who said you can't use a VCR with this set because "it doesn't have the outdated composite video input that VCRs require" is incorrect. One of the component video inputs also works as a composite input. I've attached my old VHS player, and it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Suprised how poor the sound was
Reviews.Author: S. ead "Rambles"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, nice number and range of connections possible. LN32A300 is a very nice looking TV. I read some comments on other reviews of the LN32A300 about the poor quality of the on board audio. I thought, how bad could it be?Watching satellite TV, the audio is OK. Watching DVD via HDMI connection I have had a couple of movies that I gave up on trying to watch because I couldn't understand or hear the dialog. The movies didn't have closed captioning and it didn't matter how high the volume was turned up. The volume wasn't the issue. I did use the LN32A300 audio adjustments and they helped a very small amount.I suppose that I will have to by a small 2.1 speaker system and run the audio signal out of the DVD player. This isn't my main TV and I wanted something simple that my wife wouldn't struggle with turning on multiple components to simply watch TV or a movie.

Reviews.Title: Defective components
Reviews.Author: Big Al
Reviews.Content: This model, as well as others from what I have read online, are built with defective power capacitors on the power supply board.  This is a problem that Samsung does not seem to acknowledge, and chances are the capacitors' life expectancy will be about 1-3 years of regular use.  Once they fail, the TV's response will range from:  Not turning on at all, or the red power light will flicker/stay on, but the screen will not power up at all, or the screen flickers.There could be other causes but this is the most common.  If you really want to buy this TV, get the most long-term warranty possible.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last / no customer support
Reviews.Author: C. G. Young
Reviews.Content: After 15 months and 4 days, the power went bad (stand-by power, but nothing else) and Samsung refuses to do anything other than have me pay for repair (gee, an almost $700 TV and it's probably going to cost at least a couple hundred to repair!!, not to mention, that I'm now waiting for 3-4 business days just to be contacted by a service rep so I can get an estimate).  A TV this expensive should last longer than 15 months.  It is infuriating that Samsung refuses to stand behind it's product quality. As far as I'm concerned there simply is no such thing to Samsung... and I personally will never purchase one of their products again... therefore, be forewarned.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV, but there are sound problems on many units if you don't use a cable box/DVR
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Lauber
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful TV with a great picture, but, unfortunately, the QAM tuner is defective in many of these units. The sound will get robotic and distorted on HD channels if you do not have a cable box/DVR hooked up to a defective unit. Every few minutes the sound will get really distorted when HD programming is on, last from anywhere from a few seconds to several minutes, then disappear and get really distorted again every 3-5 minutes or less. The problem may not occur right away, as it did in our case; it took a few weeks for it to occur. This happens not only on this model of Samsung LCD TVs, but on numerous others. Some units have the problem, while others do not, so getting the problem is quite random depending on what TV you get. Mostly this is a problem with Comcast, but I have heard it also happens with other cable companies without a box. Search the Internet for Samsung "distorted sound" and "robotic audio" for more information on the problem. Samsung is completely unresponsive about this problem and there are many angry owners. It's an extremely annoying problem that currently has no permanent fix. We've had the circuit board replaced once, but the sound problem came back within a matter of days. We tried to get the circuit board replaced again, but the circuit board they gave us was defective. What great products Samsung makes, huh? Then they tried to replace our TV with an older, less expensive model. Their customer service is also the worst we have ever experienced; they just don't care about their customers. We do not plan to buy any more Samsung products in the future because of our experience. We really are very disappointed.My best advice is to avoid this TV (or any Samsung LCD TV, for that matter) if you don't have a cable box. If you do have a cable box/DVR, there is no problem at all with sound and you can ignore my review. However, not everyone wants or needs a cable box (we just have basic cable and do not need the extra expense each month or the extra channels, which would cost $40 more a month at least for us), so having a faulty tuner is a big problem. There is no excuse for shoddy products. The TV should work fine in any environment, not just in homes with cable boxes, and that is the main issue here. I have no clue how this got through inspection. This has just been our experience with this TV and it has not been a good one.Update: There is a temporary fix for this problem which involves doing a factory reset by holding down the Exit button for 10 seconds and reprogramming all of the channels. This seems to fix the problem temporarily until the TV stops receiving power (either by power outage, power fluctuations, or by unplugging the TV). It's not permanent, but it's something until a permanent fix is found, if one is ever found.

Reviews.Title: As others have said, it's got bad capacitors.  LN32A330.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Griewski
Reviews.Content: Mine crapped out on me after about 1 year and 9 months of on and off use.  Samsung used underpowered capacitors and they blow after 1 to 1 and a half years of use.  Samsung has admitted to the problem though, and will make a one time repair free of charge (except for finding a box to send it in) even if the TV is out of warranty.  Customer Service was quick and friendly over the phone.  You've got to send it to a repair center and they pay for the shipping (when you send it in, send the MONITOR ONLY, it seems people have had troubles getting parts back if they send in the base and it's screws).  I just hope they put in better capacitors and not just replace the old ones with the same kind of insufficient capacitor (I haven't gotten the tv back yet so I can't say for sure).  Though it looks like it took a bit of convincing (from what I've read on forums), I find it admirable that Samsung is making an effort to fix their mistake.So with that major hiccup aside, this is a good tv.  Image quality is exceptional for the year is was made and the sound is decent as well.  Though I was pissed at first, I would buy Samsung again knowing that they do try make right with their customers.  Just know that this tv WILL MALFUNCTION eventually.

Reviews.Title: This television drives me insane.
Reviews.Author: asmusick
Reviews.Content: This tv has always turned on and off for no reason, and after two years, the picture is now upside down. (You can't make  this stuff up!) Additionally, it has an obnoxious red light on the power button to tell you that the unit is off.If you want a taste of what it's like to own this TV, go to the Samsung website and try to download an "easy manual" for LN32A330J1DXZA. I will never purchase another Samsung product again.

Reviews.Title: MANY PROBLEMS SOON AFTER WARRANTY EXPIRES!!
Reviews.Author: AT3Bills
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV (LN32A330) around Christmas of 2008.  My parents had a Samsung and I've always thought the picture quality was the best on the block.  I based my purchase solely on what I saw in the store and the specs - I did not do any research to find out if there were any systemic problems.  Well, turns out, there are a lot of problems with this and other Samsung models.  18 months after purchase I turned the TV on and the screen went black, but the sound continued to play.  So I turned it off, waited, then back on. The TV displayed an image for a fleeting second, then went black with the sound continuing to play... again. I repeated this multiple times with the same result.  I then tried switching outlets, moving it to a different room, different inputs, etc... I tried everything.  Nothing works.So, I jumped on-line last night and this problem is so popular that if you Google the model number you'll see all the different "predictive searches" that people have done, many regarding this or similar problems.  When I looked into it further, this problem is widespread, but you apparently have to fight with Samsung's customer service reps just to get them to acknowledge it's a problem.  That said, they still won't offer you anything for your problems once the TV is out of warranty. From what I've read, it costs between $200-300 to fix, plus shipping.  Considering the $550 purchase price, that's simply not feasible... and not worth it.I understand that a warranty is what it is, but if your television sets have what is clearly a systemic problem, a recall or a discounted repair is in order.  Samsung will do neither.Do not buy this television.

Reviews.Title: TV stopped working after 2 years
Reviews.Author: Leslie E. Young
Reviews.Content: We bought this as our second HD television.  It worked great for about 2 years, and then one day it wouldn't turn on.  The troubleshooting guide in the user's manual and on Samsung's website only had one suggestion: to make sure the outlet worked.  Of course, the warranty period only lasts for 90 days, so after spending $900 on a TV, we were forced to either pay to fix it or buy a new TV two years later.  This TV was a huge waste of money!

Reviews.Title: 1 year and done
Reviews.Author: Casey R. Quenette
Reviews.Content: After 1 year the power supply failed and the TV will not turn on.  Samsung is no help either.  Not buying another samasung product ever again, had a similar problem with a computer monitor from them.

Reviews.Title: Bad Gaming TV
Reviews.Author: Ethan Jennings
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this TV from Best Buy and really, really wanted to love it.  The picture was great for TV and movies, the sound was good, the price was excellent and I liked the look of the sleek, black thing sitting on my entertainment center.  Made me feel good.When I fired up the 360 to test for motion blur, though, this TV broke my heart.  I'm one of those lucky people who are extremely sensitive to motion blur in video games; it makes me almost instantly nauseous, and unfortunately this TV blurred like no other.If motion blur doesn't bother you (according to teh internetz it has something to do with the way your brain processes the image, so it might not), or you don't game, then check this TV out; it was gorgeous.  Otherwise, I cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: good tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Steven G. Campbell "steve c"
Reviews.Content: only a little more pricy than a basic model, but better picture quality. I compared these in the store at best buy and this tv was a great value. compared similarly to sony's new value (I forget the model...L? series), but since there was some talk about the budget bravia's being a rebrand, decided to go with this one... honestly, it's hard to tell picture quality unless you really mess with all the tv's settings and spend hours comparing.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for its price-range
Reviews.Author: Michael Montayer "MLM"
Reviews.Content: I bought this a little over a month ago. My eyes are not that good and playing my Xbox 360 on my 25" CRT was not helping. I wanted to go HDTV but had other $$$ priorities. Then I came across this on Amazon before the NYC tax went into affect and had some bank rewards so I decided to take the plunge and got this set for under 500. I am in heaven. My 360 looks fantastic and even my PC looks great over HDMI. Wish I could have gotten a larger version and have yet to see any HD content except for the 360 but normal stations look great and the 360 upscales DVDs and they look great on this set! Will be calling cable company to get an HD cable box when I have time. This is the best TV I have ever owned. Get it while you can.

Reviews.Title: A super deal!!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Silletti
Reviews.Content: An excellent product at an excellent price. Purchased this tv for my husband as a birthday present after researching various brands at local stores. This was definitely the BEST VALUE for the money. The picture is superb; set-up was a breeze -- all in all a very attractive package. Liked the idea of the swivel stand, although ultimately decided to mount it on the wall on an articulating bracket.

Reviews.Title: great hdtv, lousy delivery
Reviews.Author: James M. Corban
Reviews.Content: HDTV is flawless, just don't choose free delivery. I could have walked to the store and dragged it home faster. Pay, and be happy.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LN32A330 Review - TVs should last longer than 3 years
Reviews.Author: AM
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV 3 years ago for $600.  When I purchased the TV, I was in my senior year of college and had planned to have it see me through college and had planned to be able to have my TV last through college and my first few years out on my own. The first few years of having my TV were great. Picture quality was good. Sound was good. The remote was simple, but easy to use. It was great. Fast forward 3 years, one day it's working perfectly as normal and the next day it won't turn on. When I press the power button on the remote or the actual unit, the TV won't turn on.To top it off, I didn't purchase the extended warranty it 2 years ago, which means it's up to me to fix it.  At this point it's probably just easier to buy a new TV than get it fixed, which is frustrating because a $600, brand name TV should last more than 3 years.If you're thinking about purchasing this TV, I wouldn't. Go for one of the newer models and be sure to purchase the extended warranty - when the TV goes out, it won't get you a new TV, but it will help.  At least you won't have to start all over again like me.

Reviews.Title: Won't turn on after 2 years
Reviews.Author: Damir Mesic
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I enjoyed this product while it lasted. The picture quality is great, it's a nice looking tv, and I never had a complaint about it until one day it wouldn't turn on. Judging from the reviews online and on amazon this is a prevalent issue with this model. I guess I should have done some preemptive research before spending $900 for it, and judging from peoples experience samsung isn't really owning up. I'm going to take it to the shop for an estimate and if it costs more than $100 to repair it won't be worth it. Don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Bad capacitors, DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: DL520
Reviews.Content: This model (ln32a330) is known for using bad capacitors that usually die within 2 years time.  Type "samsung ln32a330" into a google search bar, without hitting enter, you will see among the most popular searches "samsung ln32a330 won't turn on" or "samsung ln32a330 capacitor".  Everyone seems to be having this problem.If it weren't for the bad lifespan, it otherwise has a great picture and sound quality.  Only other flaw is that it has a longer startup time than most other LCD HDTVs of its time that I have used.However, if you plan to keep a TV for longer than 2 years, don't buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for Gaming, Sports and Blu-Ray!!!
Reviews.Author: Little Billy
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome tv at an awesome price. I am an avid Gamer, Movie Buff and Sports Fanatic. I bought this tv last summer and just in time for the Olympics. I would recommend this tv to anyone looking for a 32" unbeatable quality and price!  BOOMER SOONER!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic T.V...excellent value!!
Reviews.Author: James B. Lund
Reviews.Content: Purchased from Amazon cheaper than anyone..Wal-mart, Sams Club, B.J's wholesale, and anywhere else I looked!!! Hooked it straight up to the Xbox 360. Samsung is known for the "gamer mode", I have played games from Call of Duty (World at War), Gears of War, Halo (all versions), and Sports games. I heard & read of LCD T.V's having a shadow or "lag", or problems with depth & black backrounds not being crisp with fast paced games....well after 2 weeks and countless games...this t.v. ROCKS!!!!!! No perceptible problems.....crisp, clear, fast. I compared this set in the store against Sony, Vizio, Sharp, Toshiba, and saw a great review where Samsung took first in LCD t.v.'s from 19" to 42" for their price range. This is worth checking out for the money, Try FIFA 09 soccer, WOW!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: My new HDTV.
Reviews.Author: Laura Carney
Reviews.Content: The T.V. is just great, especially the price. Picture is great. Delivered on time and the delivery man was very helpful.I read on Consumers Report that Samsung is rated as number 1. Also, it has a 2year warranty that comes with it.

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: P. R. RESTIVO
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for our bedroom and it works very well there. It has a great picture and the speakers are better than most televisions this size. Since it's in our bedroom, I didn't want to have to hook it up to a receiver to have good sound quality. This would also be a good TV for a kid's room where they might want to hook up a Playstation or X-Box and have good sound effects.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: John Cunningham
Reviews.Content: This is a magnificant TV. The picture is actually perfect. I have this TV hooked to an ordenery TV antenna at present  , and wow!I am getting digital programs from public TV that demonstrate just how much is acheived with HDTV.I have looked at other brands and determined that this brand has the best out of the box picture by far.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: R. Cochran
Reviews.Content: Very nice sound.  Some of the best sound I have heard coming from TV speakers.  Overall, the picture is quite good.  The TV's "dynamic mode" setting seems to produce the best picture quality.  It appears to me that Samsung and Panasonic have the best picture quality in the 32 inch category.  The TV controls are relative easy to use, although the remote looks cheap.  The base stand that comes with the TV is not the best either, but overall this TV has good picture quality and great sound!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Mark R "Mark R"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. I like everything about it except that it only has 2 HDMI inputs. I would have liked to have three, but I have gotten over it. I bought mine at Circuit City. I could not beleive how good the picture was compared to the other TVs on display.

Reviews.Title: Premature color failure
Reviews.Author: DFBonnett
Reviews.Content: We've had this set about 4 years and it is not in continuous use. One day I just turned it on and the color was all washed out, almost like a color film negative. The cost to repair it is almost the cost to replace it, so it will be junked and a new set, certainly not Samsung brand, will replace it. It is truly inexcusable when a TV that cost almost $700 only lasts 4 years.

Reviews.Title: some things about this model
Reviews.Author: Alla S.
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a while. Here's some things I found with this particular model:Pros-Exellent to use as a computer monitor, using HD input. I have watched many online shows on this, and the quality was always perfect.-Good picture quality with 1080 broadcast and regular broadcast.-Great sound.Cons-This one may not be an issue for everyone, but I have a few cassettes that I occasionally like to watch and you can't use a VCR with this tv, as there's no composite video.

Reviews.Title: audio problems after 24 months
Reviews.Author: kzim960
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this tv for the first 24 months and then audio went out on 3 channels. I purchased a 4 year service plan, thankfully, however it was at shop for over a month.  After a new mother board was installed the problem came back after a week.  After researching I have discovered others have experienced similar problems.

Reviews.Title: Bought in 2007 Still working Great
Reviews.Author: John Martinez
Reviews.Content: bought this tv in march 2007 and have been using it everyday till now to play xbox 360 thru the hdmi and watch basic cable, i started checking out reviews on google cus sumtimes i would accidently flip the channel to a channel past 100 and hear robot sounds on scrambled channels. my standard cable only have about 75 channels so it would be loud and unpleasant when i flipped it to those channels. upon looking at reviews i see alot of people having problems with the tv dying on them, power suppy problems and im juss amazed that this hasnt happened to me and feel a little lucky. i do take care of my tv though like not leaving it on when im not watching and not leaving it on a same screen for more than 5 mins and clean it reg for dust, and also try not to use it more than 4 hrs. overall i love my samsung its a nice size, sexy black, and bright beautiful colors on my hdmi xbox360. I would recommend this tv

Reviews.Title: Cheap underpowered capacitors on power supply
Reviews.Author: G. Duncan "frugal shopper"
Reviews.Content: This TV only lasted a year and a half before it wouldn't power on.  After looking around on the internet, I discovered these TVs have wide spread capacitor issues.  They are underpowered and are cheap.  They also sit right next to 2 large heat sinks on the board.  Of course I had to call numerous times and escalate with Samsung before they finally admitted to the issue and they sent me a prepaid label to send it in to their outsourced NJ service center.  3 weeks and several calls later my TV has finally arrived fixed sans my hardware to connect the base to the TV.  Now I'm scrambling to track these parts down.  And Samsung blames me for sending in the parts so they won't replace them.  Oh well, at least my TV works.  I'll probably try a Sony next time.

Reviews.Title: Samsung as pure as a lung
Reviews.Author: Abedin Ambakhutwala "Gabbar Singh"
Reviews.Content: After much reviewing and persistant requesting (nagging...hahahah!) from my wife, I bought this TV for our bedroom. Initially I wanted a TV/DVD combo but then I thought that I can always connect my computer to the TV and watch movies if I want to and besides there aren't many LCD TV/DVD combos in 32 inches available in the market and the ones available are either too expensive or have not scored that many points. So that was the back ground of it.The TV....oh man...what a TV. Really love it. It is 720p and I do not have HD programming so this TV is perfect for SD streaming. The picture is so crisp and clear. The sound which was my main criteria of selection since it was for the bedroom, is very clear, does not echo or distort.There is a sweet sound that I love when the TV is turned on and off. It is light weight.Ironically, even though the TV is so good I had to hang it --- on the wall, yes I wall mounted it with the help of my friend.I am guessing this TV is getting replaced by newer TVs, so u wud expect its price to go down but this TV is so good I doubt they will further reduce its price. It's worth the money.Hey Amazon guys, I really hope people read this review and buy this TV and if that happens, if the sales of this TV goes up then I shall be waiting for a handsome reward from u....hahahaha!

Reviews.Title: Great 720p HD TV
Reviews.Author: Brandon Schaffer
Reviews.Content: This product is a very good product for a 720p TV.  I was impressed, and always have been impressed with Samsung TV's.  For the price very good TV.  I went with this one right now, because I am going to get a Full HD when we get a new house.  It does have a fewer options than I would like: such as only two HDMI inputs, but again I will get more with a Full HD TV someday.  I would recommend just about any Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: L. A. "chattesauvage"
Reviews.Content: Few months ago, my 19 year old son bought a Samsung HD TV. I was very impressed with the picture. Later, after reading many good reviews in Consumer Reports about this TV and other Samsung TV's I decided to buy one.So far, I am very happy with this TV. The colors and images are sharp, very clear and lifelike.Controls are very easy to adjust and the functions are extremely easy to learn  how to use.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: Tabatha R. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: we absolutely love this tv! it has very good picture quality! we also love that it has the ability to swivel which makes it easier to connect a dvd player, game console etc. and also makes viewing at any angle possible without having to move the entire tv.

Reviews.Title: The Best!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I just bought this TV.  It is amazing.  Easy to set up...clear picture...great sound...amazing response time...and it picks up approximately 15 over the air free HD channels.  Furthermore, the delivery was excellent (came about a week early).  I will definitely use Amazon.com to buy future HDTV's.  Thank you Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but doesn't last
Reviews.Author: T. Wesely "joliemidwestgirl"
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for about 5 years now, the video card just went out on it, and the repair guy said that this tv has about 8 versions, so it's obvious that they have a known problem with it and were unable to fix it.  However, it worked really well, loved the picture and the sound was ok.

Reviews.Title: A Bad Dream?
Reviews.Author: MattC
Reviews.Content: I hate to write negative reviews on products but this tv deserves it. I bought this tv a few days ago and couldn't believe how terrible the picture was. Could I have been having a bad dream in which I couldn't awake? The picture had terrible blacks if you can call them blacks. They looked more like dirty dishwater. The picture was a washed out gray. Colors seemed to all run together. They seemed so undefined to my eyes. Colors reminded me of wet watercolors all running together. I tried every adjustment I could think of to get the picture to look better but no success. The only things I liked about the entire tv was the sound and the looks of the tv. The black shiny set had a real sexy sleek look to it. I liked the frequency sliders to tune the sound to my preference. When comparing the picture of the Samsung to my two Philips lcds,there was not contest. The Philips picture was so much better than this set.I wasn't able to look at the picture using a dvd player because the HDMI and component imputs would not work. I kept getting an onscreen message telling me that there was no signal detected. Anyway, I figured maybe I just got a defective unit. I took the tv back and decided to try again. I exchanged it for the exact same model. When I got the second Samsung all hooked up, the picture was just as terrible. Could I have gotten two models in a row that were defective? I don't think so. This time the HDMI, Component, and composite inputs worked. I couldn't get a descent picture even with my blu-ray player connected to the HDMI input. What a let down I felt with this piece of junk. Another annoying thing about this model was the remote. You can't just push station numbers on the remote to switch from watching dvds to watching tv. You have to push the source button first. I've never had this type of setup on any of my lcd tvs. I've always been able to go directly to a tv station from any input by pushing a station number. I would advise any potential buyers of this set to refrain. I don't think you'll be happy with it unless you are comming directly from the crt tvs and don't know how good a lcd set can look. Stay away from this one.Samsung LN32A330 32-Inch 720p LCD HDTV

Reviews.Title: Another Burned SAMSUNG Customer
Reviews.Author: James Morris
Reviews.Content: This TV was great while it lasted.  I purchased it in late 2010 for $400 on sale.Every so often, it would shut itself off.  Last night, it died.  While watching a DVD, the screen went "pop".  Now there's no sound, no picture and all the damned thing will do when powered on is cycle on and off every ten seconds, like it's trying to reset itself.  I researched the problem on-line and found out that this is a "known issue" with many SAMSUNG flat-screens across the board and that the unit would cost more to fix than it's worth.I'm going to call Samsung tomorrow and give them a piece of my mind and then I'm going out and buy a SONY, like my gut told me I should have done in the first place.Phooey.

Reviews.Title: TV just fried...
Reviews.Author: Rickbass "Rickbass"
Reviews.Content: I got about four years out of this tv and just turned it on and it fried with a loud crackle and pop. DO NOT BUY THIS TV

Reviews.Title: Thumbs down
Reviews.Author: Gary O "wudooeyeno?"
Reviews.Content: Have two samsung monitors and a 26" lcd tv. All amazing. Just picked this 32" one up and... well... it's horrendous.Very dim and washed out picture. Set to dynamic it's very pixelated. But since most here say it's got a great picture maybe I just got a bad one. (sound is great) At any rate, it's going back.
